# Reference

## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`vmware`](#vmware): Manage installation of VMware Tools and related options.

## Classes

### <a name="vmware"></a>`vmware`

Manage installation of VMware Tools and related options.
Will remove vmware tools that has been installed from script if present.
Will use open-vm-tools by default on RHEL 7+, SUSE 12+, and Ubuntu 12+,
for all other the default is VMware OSP packages.

#### Examples

##### install VMware tools with all default settings

```puppet
class { 'vmware': }
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `vmware` class:

* [`manage_repo`](#manage_repo)
* [`repo_base_url`](#repo_base_url)
* [`manage_service`](#manage_service)
* [`service_name`](#service_name)
* [`service_provider`](#service_provider)

* [`esx_version`](#esx_version)
* [`gpgkey_url`](#gpgkey_url)
* [`proxy_host`](#proxy_host)
* [`proxy_port`](#proxy_port)
* [`prefer_open_vm_tools`](#prefer_open_vm_tools)
* [`force_open_vm_tools`](#force_open_vm_tools)
* [`manage_tools_nox_package`](#manage_tools_nox_package)
* [`tools_nox_package_name`](#tools_nox_package_name)
* [`tools_nox_package_ensure`](#tools_nox_package_ensure)

* [`tools_x_package_ensure`](#tools_x_package_ensure)

##### <a name="manage_repo"></a>`manage_repo`

Data type: `Any`

If repo file should be managed.

Default value: `'USE_DEFAULTS'`

##### <a name="repo_base_url"></a>`repo_base_url`

Data type: `Any`

Base URL of mirror of packages.vmware.com/tools/esx.

Default value: `'http://packages.vmware.com/tools/esx'`

##### <a name="manage_service"></a>`manage_service`

Data type: `Any`

If vmwaretools service should be managed.

Default value: ``true``

##### <a name="service_name"></a>`service_name`

Data type: `Any`

Service name to manage.

Default value: `'USE_DEFAULTS'`

##### <a name="service_provider"></a>`service_provider`

Data type: `Any`

Service provider, based on package type, `service` for open-vm-tools, `init` for OSP.

Default value: `'USE_DEFAULTS'`

##### <a name="service_path"></a>`service_path`

Data type: `Any`

Path to service init files. `/etc/vmwre-tools/init/`, only applicable for `init` service provider.

Default value: `'USE_DEFAULTS'`

##### <a name="esx_version"></a>`esx_version`

Data type: `Any`

Version of ESX (e.g. 5.1, 5.5, 5.5ep06). Note, it is recommended to explicitly set the esx version rather than default to latest.

Default value: `'latest'`

##### <a name="gpgkey_url"></a>`gpgkey_url`

Data type: `Any`

URL for VMware GPG key. Defaults to http://packages.vmware.com/tools/keys/VMWARE-PACKAGING-GPG-RSA-KEY.pub.

Default value: `'http://packages.vmware.com/tools/keys/VMWARE-PACKAGING-GPG-RSA-KEY.pub'`

##### <a name="proxy_host"></a>`proxy_host`

Data type: `Any`

Hostname of web proxy (not supported on SUSE).

Default value: `'absent'`

##### <a name="proxy_port"></a>`proxy_port`

Data type: `Any`

Port number of web proxy.

Default value: `8080`

##### <a name="prefer_open_vm_tools"></a>`prefer_open_vm_tools`

Data type: `Any`

Prefer open-vm-tools over vmware-tools in the case that both are available (e.g. Ubuntu 12.04).

Default value: ``true``

##### <a name="force_open_vm_tools"></a>`force_open_vm_tools`

Data type: `Any`

Force open-vm-tools over vmware-tools. Using this option is suitable in cases where EPEL is available for EL systems.

Default value: ``false``

##### <a name="manage_tools_nox_package"></a>`manage_tools_nox_package`

Data type: `Any`

If vmwaretools nox package should be managed.

Default value: ``true``

##### <a name="tools_nox_package_name"></a>`tools_nox_package_name`

Data type: `Any`

Name of package for vmwaretools nox package.

Default value: `'USE_DEFAULTS'`

##### <a name="tools_nox_package_ensure"></a>`tools_nox_package_ensure`

Data type: `Any`

String to pass to ensure attribute for the vmwaretools nox package.

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="manage_tools_x_package"></a>`manage_tools_x_package`

Data type: `Any`

If vmwaretools x package should be managed.

Default value: `'USE_DEFAULTS'`

##### <a name="tools_x_package_name"></a>`tools_x_package_name`

Data type: `Any`

Name of package for vmwaretools x package.

Default value: `'USE_DEFAULTS'`

##### <a name="tools_x_package_ensure"></a>`tools_x_package_ensure`

Data type: `Any`

String to pass to ensure attribute for the vmwaretools x package.

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="tools_conf_path"></a>`tools_conf_path`

Data type: `Any`

Path to vmware-tools configuration file.

Default value: `'/etc/vmware-tools/tools.conf'`

##### <a name="disable_tools_version"></a>`disable_tools_version`

Data type: `Any`

Disable tools version reporting to vSphere.

Default value: ``true``

##### <a name="enable_sync_driver"></a>`enable_sync_driver`

Data type: `Any`

Enable vmtools sync driver on snapshots.  `true`, `false`, `auto` to enable on non-buggy systems.
See KB2038606 (http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2038606)
https://access.redhat.com/solutions/484303

Default value: `'auto'`

##### <a name="working_kernel_release"></a>`working_kernel_release`

Data type: `Any`

First non-buggy kernel version for sync driver.

Default value: `'USE_DEFAULTS'`
